29 /*** Defines **********************************************************************/
30 
31 //! used by some of the fractional integer codes
32 #define VOIP_CODEC_OUTPUT_FRACTIONAL (12)
33 
34 //! operate on active codec (passed for ident, valid for VoipDestroy, VoipControl)
35 #define VOIP_CODEC_ACTIVE (-1)
36 
37 /*** Macros ***********************************************************************/
38 
39 /*** Type Definitions *************************************************************/
40 
41 //! opaque module ref
42 typedef struct VoipCodecRefT VoipCodecRefT;
43 
44 //! create function type
45 typedef VoipCodecRefT *(VoipCodecCreateT)(int32_t iNumDecoders);
46 
47 //! destroy function type
48 typedef void (VoipCodecDestroyT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState);
49 
50 //! encode function type
51 typedef int32_t (VoipCodecEncodeT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState, uint8_t *pOutput, const int16_t *pInput, int32_t iNumSamples);
52 
53 //! decode function type
54 typedef int32_t (VoipCodecDecodeT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState, int32_t *pOutput, const uint8_t *pInput, int32_t iInputBytes, int32_t iChannel);
55 
56 //! reset function type
57 typedef void (VoipCodecResetT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState);
58 
59 //! control function type
60 typedef int32_t (VoipCodecControlT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState, int32_t iSelect, int32_t iValue, int32_t iValue2, void *pValue);
61 
62 //! status function type
63 typedef int32_t (VoipCodecStatusT)(VoipCodecRefT *pState, int32_t iSelect, int32_t iValue, void *pBuffer, int32_t iBufSize);
64 
65 //! codec function block
66 typedef struct VoipCodecDefT
67 {
68  VoipCodecCreateT *pCreate;
69  VoipCodecDestroyT *pDestroy;
70  VoipCodecEncodeT *pEncode;
71  VoipCodecDecodeT *pDecode;
72  VoipCodecResetT *pReset;
73  VoipCodecControlT *pControl;
74  VoipCodecStatusT *pStatus;
75 } VoipCodecDefT;
76 
77 //! codec state structure
78 struct VoipCodecRefT
79 {
80  const VoipCodecDefT *pCodecDef;
81  int32_t iDecodeChannels;
82 
83  #if DIRTYCODE_LOGGING
84  int32_t iDebugLevel; //<! debug level
85  #endif
86 
87  // VAD
88  float fVadPowerThreshold; //<! signal level threshold (power of) used to detect silence in a single frame
89  int32_t iVadCumulSilenceFrames; //<! cumulative count of recently detected silent frame (in non-stop sequence)
90  int32_t iVadSilenceFramesThreshold;//<! number of back-to-back silence frames required to detect silence
91  uint8_t bVadEnabled; //<! whether VAD is enabled or not
92  uint8_t bVadSilent; //<! whether voice is currently considered silent or not
93 };
94

102 
103 
104 // register a codec type
105 DIRTYCODE_API void VoipCodecRegister(int32_t iCodecIdent, const VoipCodecDefT *pCodecDef);
106 
107 // create a codec module
108 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecCreate(int32_t iCodecIdent, int32_t iDecodeChannels);
109 
110 // customize codec
111 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecControl(int32_t iCodecIdent, int32_t iControl, int32_t iValue, int32_t iValue2, void *pValue);
112 
113 // get codec status
114 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecStatus(int32_t iCodecIdent, int32_t iSelect, int32_t iValue, void *pBuffer, int32_t iBufSize);
115 
116 // destroy active codec
117 DIRTYCODE_API void VoipCodecDestroy(void);
118 
119 // reset active codec
120 DIRTYCODE_API void VoipCodecReset(void);
121 
122 // encode using the active codec
123 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecEncode(uint8_t *pOutput, const int16_t *pInput, int32_t iNumSamples);
124 
125 // decode using the active codec
126 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecDecode(int32_t *pOutput, const uint8_t *pInput, int32_t iInputBytes, int32_t iChannel);
127 
128 #ifdef __cplusplus
129 }
130 #endif
